title: On Tuza's Conjecture in Dense Graphs

lemmas.name: tuza_complete_4partite
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_complete_4partite (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : isComplete4Partite G) : 2 * triangleCoveringNumber G â‰¤ 3 * trianglePackingNumber G

lemmas.name: complete_4partite_tight
lemmas.statement: This bound is tight - examples exist achieving tau = (3/2)*nu
lemmas.english: The 3/2 bound is optimal for complete 4-partite

key_insight: Dense graphs (complete multipartite) satisfy BETTER bounds than Tuza. Bad graphs for nu=4 must avoid this structure.
implications_for_nu4: If nu=4 has tau >= 9, it's NOT complete 4-partite
notes: Strong evidence that dense nu=4 graphs are fine
